title: How has the number of patients not treated 28 days after a cancelled operation changed?
analysis_commentary:
Since April 2003 the NHS constitution pledges that if the hospital cancels your operation at the last minute for non-clinical reasons, they should offer you a new date for your operation. This date should be within 28 days of the date your operation was originally booked for.

The proportion of patients whose elective operations were cancelled and not treated within 28 days has decreased over the time and shows similar seasonal variation. Between quarter 4 of 1994/95 and 2014/15, this an absolute drop of five per cent, which represents a 37 per cent decrease.
